item.Name: always render in floating shadow#will not work on child objects
extension of parent#object uses parent's markers
effects created by this object do not spawn objects in multiplayer
does not collide with camera#force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide
force collide with camera#force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide
damage not blocked by obstructions#AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.
grab parent object in forge editing
Renderer should send visibility up to game thread
Sleep when not visible to player
Killed on first contact or damage#the object is killed instantly the first time it is contacted or damaged (optional grace period below)
Self-destruct timer kills instead of destroying#object is killed instantly, not destroyed (deleted) when the self-destruct timer expires

_field_real.name: bounding radius#If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.
rolling ramp up time:seconds#how long it takes to set the rolling ramp RTPC from 0-1
grinding ramp up time:seconds#how long it takes to set the grinding ramp RTPC from 0-1

plugin._field_explanation: Damage source name for all damage caused by this object. This includes: - collision damage caused by this object - melee damage caused by this object (including melee-like special abilities) - damage caused by projectiles created by this object - damage caused by damage effects created by this object (such as weapon backfiring)

_field_explanation.name: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

_field_tag_reference_64.name: melee sound#this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

_field_real.name: kill on first contact or damage after time:seconds#grace period before object can be instantly killed by kill on first contact or damage flag
self-destruct time:seconds#if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.
self-destruct time max:seconds#if non-zero, defines range from which self-destruct time is chosen randomly

_field_string_id.name: ai type name#used for combat dialogue, etc.
interaction name#if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object (NYI - you can use any)

item.Name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
mapping does not controls active#the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound
random time offset#function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1
always exports value#when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value
turn off with uses magnitude#the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

_field_string_id.name: import name#if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable
turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function
ranged interpolation name#if you have the ranged button checked

_field_real.name: min value#function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

_field_block_64.name: interpolation

item.Name: fractional#covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

_field_real.name: linear travel time:s#used by constant velocity

_field_block_64._field_explanation: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

_field_real.name: spring k#used by damped spring determines acceleration by displacement
spring c#used by damped spring determines damping based on velocity
fraction:0-1#used by fractional how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

_field_long_integer.name: runtime interpolator to object function mapping*!

_field_real_bounds.name: selection bounds#if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

item.Name: never delete on bsp transition#This object and any objects in its parent-child chain will never be deleted when transitioning between BSPs
Aim assist raycast does not ignore parents
Combine child shapes into convext hull when cutting navmesh

_field_tag_reference_64.name: type^
_field_tag_reference_64.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

_field_tag_reference_64.name: override type#this attachment will override the attachment on the object that shares this
_field_tag_reference_64.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

item.Name: force always on#when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string
effect size scale from object scale
works on land#drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

_field_string_id.name: variant name#if empty, may be used by any model variant

item.Name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

_field_block_64.name: multiplayer object
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping

item.Name: Only render if editable{only render in editor}{only visible in editor}#This object will only render if you're in editor, or in a Forge game where the instance of the object is Forge-able
DEPRECATED phased physics in forge{phased physics in forge}
Only collision if editable{only collision in editor}#This object will only have collision if you're in editor, or in a Forge game and the instance of the object is Forge-able
Only physics if editable{only physics in editor}#This object will only have physics if you're in editor, or in a Forge game and the instance of the object is Forge-able
Force render in Forge#Regardless of 'do not render if can't be edited' or other flags, we will try to render this object in Forge games

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

_field_block_64.name: falloff function#Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here
These are default shaders used for boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for spherical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for cylindrical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for box boundary geometry
These fields are used for default behaviors in Forge mode

_field_string_id.name: Default Primary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.
Default Secondary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.
Default Tertiary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.

_field_char_integer.name: Default Primary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.
Default Secondary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.
Default Tertiary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.

_field_string_id.name: Default Label [1]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [2]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [3]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [4]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Variant Name#Only use this if your object has multiple variants

_field_tag_reference_64.name: simulation_interpolation#Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

_field_block_64.name: spawn effects
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: multiplayer spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in MP games
campaign spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

_field_string_id.name: alias of#(Optional) If set will internally read this instead of 'id' to generate the smoothed value. Can be used to create smoothed aliases of existing functions.

_field_block_64.name: Tracking Info&Spartan Tracking

_field_explanation.name: Map these settings to a ping type

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
Active - This is generated manually by the player, by pressing a button on their controller. This behavior will override passive behavior.
Passive - This is a constant ping, automatically generated by the tracking system. Use this to mark things automatically as the player comes into range.
You should create at most one block of Spartan Tracking data for each ping type. If you have more, only the first will be used.

_field_char_enum.name: ping type^#ping type to which these settings apply

item.Name: trackable#this object may respond to the ping of a Spartan tracking device
enabled by default#this object is trackable by default, i.e. tracking does not need to be enabled via script
outline#render an outline around the object when pinged
immediate response#ping affects this object immediately, only applicable to active ping type
follow offscreen#nav marker will follow this object while offscreen
do not track children#prevent tracking of child objects
do not outline children#prevent outlining of child objects

_field_char_enum.name: priority#category used to limit the number of simultaneously marked targets
outline color index#index into outline material's 4-color 'outline_color' parameter

_field_real_fraction.name: outline intensity:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used
outline thickness:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used

_field_string_id.name: nav point screen#name of the screen used to mark this object when hit by a ping
nav point label#label displayed via the nav point screen

_field_real.name: nav point vertical offset:world units#offset used when displaying the nav point screen and label

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Leave the override set to 0 if you'd like to use the default range. A set of default ranges, for each ping type, is stored under the Spartan Tracking section of globals.globals. Each set specifies a default range for each target priority.

_field_real.name: range&range override#maximum distance at which this object can be hit by a ping

_field_long_flags.name: team filter#character teams that can't ping this object

item.Name: blue team#The Chief and his crew
blue team cracked#The Chief and his crew, but Chief has a cracked visor

_field_tag_reference_64.name: ping hit instigator effect 0&team Chief ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 1{ping hit instigator effect}&team Locke ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit effect 0&team Chief ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 1{ping hit effect}&team Locke ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping

item.Name: detonation max time if attached#If attach happens timeout is set to timer.high
allow deceleration below final velocity#use for bouncing projectiles that also have initial/final velocity so that can reliably come to rest.
supports tethering#projectile waits for trigger unlatch before immediately detonating
damage_not_predictable_by_clients#used on the focus rifle to disable observer shield flash prediction for a high-dps weapon that does low damage per projectile
collides with physics-only surfaces#aka sphere-only collision. Use this for projectiles that you want to bounce smoothly up stairs, but don't use it for projectiles that may come to rest on stairs
detonates when attached to objects#when projectiles move slowly enough they attach to objects or come to rest. Check this for projectiles that don't normally attach to things like frag grenades
cannot be detached by equipment#armor lock will not detach these projectiles - for the airstrike
does not collide with world geometry#this gun shoots through schools
is collectible#Projectile is collectible by projectile collector equipment
combinations of projectiles from different weapons or different bursts of the same weapon will not trigger super combine detonation
distance based damage scaling uses damage range low bounds#damage scales from 1.f --> 0.f between 'damage range - low' --> 'damage range - high'
skip object first tick#similar to Disable instantaneous first tick, but there's actually two types of ticks
use projectile camera in killcam#when killed with this type of projectile, whether or not the camera follows the projectile in Kill Cam.
detonates on attachment to equipped weapon#if the projectile attaches to a weapon that is held by a biped, it detonates immediately
Use projectile radius for thickness testing#IF THIS IS OFF, NO THICKNESS OR CHUBBY TESTS ARE PERFORMED.
Expensive chubby test#Will only be active if thickness testing is ON.
Use play collision#Will use simple and smooth collision mesh.
Highlight projectile in vision mode#Makes the projectile show up as an enemy in vision mode
biped proximity enemies only#modifies behavior of 'detonation biped proximity'
always use localized physics#overrides early mover localize projectiles
never use localized physics#overrides early mover localize projectiles
is considered a grenade#treated as a grenade for purposes of AI dialogue and player grenade damage multipliers
can be deflected by enemies#enemies can knock this away under certain circumstances
hits prefer parent to items#a projectile will pass through an item if it will hit its parent
after first bounce off floor{after first bounce}
after first bounce off any surface
silent#ai will not respond to this sound
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range

_field_real.name: detonation biped proximity:wu#if >0, both 'detonation timer starts' + a biped must be within this proximity for condition to be met; see 'biped proximity enemies only' flag
air burst proximity:wu#will detonate the projectile mid flight if it comes within this range
max lifetime to detonate:seconds#if >0, projectile will detonate regardless of other conditions after this total time
extent (+/-) to which max lifetime may vary
arming time:seconds#won't detonate before this time elapses
danger stimuli radius:world units#Overrides the danger radius when non-zero for stimuli related danger radius calculations.

_field_short_integer.name: danger group burst count#The number of projectiles in this burst before this burst is considered dangerous
danger group burst max count#The maximum number of projectiles we allow in a group

_field_real.name: minimum velocity:world units per second#detonates when slowed below this velocity
maximum range:world units#detonates after travelling this distance
bounce maximum range:world units#detonates after travelling this distance, but is reset after a bounce. Combines with maximum range
max latch time to detonate:seconds#projectile will detonate regardless of weapon latching after this total time
max latch time to arm:seconds#projectile will arm itself regardless of detonation mode if latched for this amount of time.

item.Name: silent#ai will not respond to this sound
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range

_field_real.name: super combine proximity distance:wu#make greater than 0 to enable distance based super combine
tether release safety delay#if the weapon the projectile is tethered to loses its owner, this amount of time will pass before detonation

plugin._field_explanation: A detonating tethered projectile attached to an object will use the 'super' versions of damage ie 'super attached detonation damage' instead of 'attached detonation damage'.

_field_real.name: material effect radius#radius within we will generate material effects
material effect bounce hard speed threshold:if the projectile velocity into the surface is greater than or equal to this will be treated as a hard bounce (otherwise medium bounce)
material effect bounce medium speed threshold:if the projectile velocity into the surface is greater than or equal to this will be treated as a medium bounce (otherwise soft bounce)
flyby sound offset:wu#offset along projectile path. + values = towards where it came from. - values = towards where it is going. 0 defaults to 0.1

plugin._field_explanation: damage range low is unused unless 'distance based damage scaling uses damage range low bounds' flag is true.

_field_real.name: air gravity scale#the proportion of normal gravity applied to the projectile when in air.

_field_real_bounds.name: air damage range:world units#the range over which damage is scaled when the projectile is in air.

_field_real.name: water gravity scale#the proportion of normal gravity applied to the projectile when in water.

_field_real_bounds.name: water damage range:world units#the range over which damage is scaled when the projectile is in water.

_field_real.name: initial velocity:world units per second#bullet's velocity when inflicting maximum damage
final velocity:world units per second#bullet's velocity when inflicting minimum damage
indirect fire velocity:world units per second#base velocity used for ballistics calculations for indirect firing.
ai velocity scale (normal):[0-1]#scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on normal difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0
ai velocity scale (heroic):[0-1]#scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on heroic difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)
ai velocity scale (legendary):[0-1]#scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)
ai guided angular velocity scale (normal):[0-1]#scale on the guided angular velocity when fired by the ai on normal difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0
ai guided angular velocity scale (legendary):[0-1]#scale on the guided angular velocity when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)

_field_angle.name: guided angular velocity at rest:degrees per second

_field_real_bounds.name: acceleration range:world units#what distance range the projectile goes from initial velocity to final velocity

_field_real_fraction.name: ai target leading scale (easy):[0.1]#(0 defaults to 1.0) scale on the target leading when fired by the ai on easy difficulty
ai target leading scale (normal):[0.1]#(0 defaults to 1.0) scale on the target leading when fired by the ai on normal difficulty
ai target leading scale (heroic):[0.1]#(0 defaults to 1.0) scale on the target leading when fired by the ai on heroic difficulty
ai target leading scale (legendary):[0.1]#(0 defaults to 1.0) scale on the target leading when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty

_field_block_64.name: old material responses{material responses}!
_field_block_64._field_explanation: (if the potential result, below, fails to happen)

item.Name: only against units (except giants){only against units}
never against units (except giants){never against units}

_field_angle.name: angular noise:degrees#the angle of incidence is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

_field_real.name: velocity noise:world units per second#the velocity is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.
initial friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity lost on penetration
parallel friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity parallel to the surface lost on impact
perpendicular friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity perpendicular to the surface lost on impact

never against units (except giants){never against units}

initial friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity lost on penetration
parallel friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity parallel to the surface lost on impact
perpendicular friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity perpendicular to the surface lost on impact

_field_block_64.name: conical spread
_field_block_64._field_explanation: projectile_count = yaw_count*pitch_count This block has no effect if _projectile_disable_instantaneous_first_tick is set or projectile has not been fired from a weapon.

_field_real.name: distribution exponent#exp==.5 even distribution, exp==1 halo2 distribution, exp>1== weighted towards center

_field_tag_reference_64.name: grounded friction settings#If not present, the default from global.globals is used.

_field_real_point_3d.name: killcam projectile camera offsets#Offsets for the projectile cam, based off the projectile's bounding radius (ie. 2.0 will adjust 2x radius behind/above/left-of projectile)

_field_long_block_index.name: Attachment Index#Sound attachment to affect - leave empty for main body

_field_real.name: sound projectile rtpc weight#the weight of this projectile in the weighted rtpc functions

_field_block_64.name: submunition events

_field_short_enum.name: placement#how to place the submunition(s), relative to the parent projectile
trigger#event that causes submunition(s) to spawn (after specified delay)

item.Name: parenticide#destroy parent projectile when spawning submunition(s)
inherit target#inherit parent projectile's targeting data

_field_byte_integer.name: max recursion depth:[0,31]#max number of times a projectile of this type can be recursively spawned

_field_real_fraction.name: inherited velocity:percentage [0,1]#how much velocity the submunition will inherit from the parent projectile

_field_custom.name: initial velocity bounds:world units per second#initial velocity along the submunition's forward (added to inherited velocity)

_field_real_bounds.name: initial velocity bounds:world units per second#initial velocity along the submunition's forward (added to inherited velocity)

_field_explanation.name: The following fields are for default placment only

_field_real_vector_3d.name: relative offset#initial location relative to the parent projectile
offset variance#extents to which the relative offset may vary (+/-)

_field_explanation.name: The following fields are for spherical placment only

_field_custom.name: radius bounds:world units#initial distance from the parent projectile

_field_real_bounds.name: radius bounds:seconds#initial distance from the parent projectile

_field_real_vector_3d.name: individual variance#extents to which the initial location of clustered submunitions may vary (+/-)

_field_explanation.name: The following fields are for default orientation

_field_block_64._field_explanation: They are used as a fallback for biped orientation

_field_real_euler_angles_2d.name: relative orientation:degrees#initial orientation relative to the parent projectile
orientation variance:degrees#extents to which the relative orientation may vary (+/-)

_field_explanation.name: The following fields are used for biped orientation only.

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
If a submunition set to orient towards bipeds fails to locate a target meeting all the given constraints, it will use the default orientation settings instead.
Some biped orientation constraints are configured using a range of values, or extents. A constraint is chosen from within that range by lerping between the two extents, using a fraction based on the distance from the parent projectile to the biped.
That fraction is calculated by clamping the biped distance to a value between the near and far distances, and evaluating g():
c = clamped biped distance N = near distance F = far distance
g(c) = (c - N) / (F - N)
So, a biped at a "near" distance or closer would produce a value of 0 while a biped at a "far" distance or further would produce a value of 1.
Now, for example, let's say you have a fraction of 0.25 and you want to know what the base probability is for a submunition to spawn given a "probability at near distance" of 0.8 and a "probability at far distance" of 1.0. You would lerp between the extents 0.8 and 1.0 at 0.25:
0.8 + 0.25 x (1.0 - 0.8)
giving you:
0.85 or 85%

item.Name: set biped target#set targeting data to selected biped (if any)
preserve inherited target#prevents biped target selection from overriding inherited targeting data

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Each potential biped target will be evaluated until one is found to meet all the given constraints. The order in which they are evaluated is specified below.

The following extents serve two purposes. First, the far distance is used to determine if a biped is close enough to be considered a valid target. Second, the pair of distances are used as domain extents when calculating other constraints. See the explanation at the top of this group of fields for more info.

_field_real.name: orientation check distance&far distance#0 defaults to 2.5

_field_block_64._field_explanation: When determining if a submunition will orient itself towards a nearby biped, it evaluates how far it will have to deviate from its current trajectory. The limit to how far it may deviate from its course is defined by lerping between the following two values.

_field_angle.name: max deviation at near distance:[0-180] degrees
max deviation at far distance:[0-180] degrees

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Do not use for predicted projectiles When determining if a submunition will orient itself towards a nearby biped, the likelihood is found by lerping between the following two values. If both are 0, they will be assumed to be uninitialized and changed to 1

_field_real_fraction.name: ai probability modifier:[0-1]#scales the probabilities above, if the projectile was fired by an AI unit

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Do not use for predicted projectiles

_field_angle.name: spread at near distance:[0-360] degrees#spread calculation uses uniform distribution
spread at far distance:[0-360] degrees#spread calculation uses uniform distribution

plugin._field_explanation: Each potential biped target will be evaluated until one is found to meet all the given constraints. The order in which they are evaluated is specified below.

The following extents serve two purposes. First, the far distance is used to determine if a biped is close enough to be considered a valid target. Second, the pair of distances are used as domain extents when calculating other constraints. See the explanation at the top of this group of fields for more info.

_field_real.name: orientation check distance&far distance#0 defaults to 2.5

plugin._field_explanation: When determining if a submunition will orient itself towards a nearby biped, it evaluates how far it will have to deviate from its current trajectory. The limit to how far it may deviate from its course is defined by lerping between the following two values.

_field_angle.name: max deviation at near distance:[0-180] degrees
max deviation at far distance:[0-180] degrees

_field_real_fraction.name: ai probability modifier:[0-1]#scales the probabilities above, if the projectile was fired by an AI unit

_field_angle.name: spread at near distance:[0-360] degrees#spread calculation uses uniform distribution
